result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kesean Armon Pierce

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kesean Armon Pierce in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Kesean Armon Pierce. Prosecuting attorney John J Rejowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense requests projected plea and sentencing date. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kesean Armon Pierce in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kesean Armon Pierce appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for status conference. Discovery and offer not yet received. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

HELD OFF THE RECORD
Defendant Kesean Armon Pierce in court, appear in person. Case set for status following 22CF2093 & 22CF2092. Matter is adjourned to Br. 4. Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Kesean McCullum and Kewone Brooks, Christian F., and Joseph K.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kesean Armon Pierce in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
